00063 /**** Group ****/
00064 
00065 bNodeSocket *node_group_find_input(bNode *gnode, bNodeSocket *gsock)
00066 {
00067     bNodeSocket *sock;
00068     for (sock=gnode->inputs.first; sock; sock=sock->next)
00069         if (sock->groupsock == gsock)
00070             return sock;
00071     return NULL;
00072 }
00073 
00074 bNodeSocket *node_group_find_output(bNode *gnode, bNodeSocket *gsock)
00075 {
00076     bNodeSocket *sock;
00077     for (sock=gnode->outputs.first; sock; sock=sock->next)
00078         if (sock->groupsock == gsock)
00079             return sock;
00080     return NULL;
00081 }
00082 
00083 bNodeSocket *node_group_add_extern_socket(bNodeTree *UNUSED(ntree), ListBase *lb, int in_out, bNodeSocket *gsock)
00084 {
00085     bNodeSocket *sock;
00086     
00087     if (gsock->flag & SOCK_INTERNAL)
00088         return NULL;
00089     
00090     sock= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bNodeSocket), "sock");
00091     
00092     /* make a copy of the group socket */
00093     *sock = *gsock;
00094     sock->link = NULL;
00095     sock->next = sock->prev = NULL;
00096     sock->new_sock = NULL;
00097     
00098     /* group sockets are dynamically added */
00099     sock->flag |= SOCK_DYNAMIC;
00100     
00101     sock->own_index = gsock->own_index;
00102     sock->groupsock = gsock;
00103     sock->limit = (in_out==SOCK_IN ? 1 : 0xFFF);
00104     
00105     sock->default_value = node_socket_make_default_value(sock->type);
00106     node_socket_copy_default_value(sock->type, sock->default_value, gsock->default_value);
00107     
00108     if (lb)
00109         BLI_addtail(lb, sock);
00110     
00111     return sock;
00112 }
00113 
00114 bNode *node_group_make_from_selected(bNodeTree *ntree)
00115 {
00116     bNodeLink *link, *linkn;
00117     bNode *node, *gnode, *nextn;
00118     bNodeTree *ngroup;
00119     bNodeSocket *gsock;
00120     ListBase anim_basepaths = {NULL, NULL};
00121     float min[2], max[2];
00122     int totnode=0;
00123     bNodeTemplate ntemp;
00124     
00125     INIT_MINMAX2(min, max);
00126     
00127     /* is there something to group? also do some clearing */
00128     for (node= ntree->nodes.first; node; node= node->next) {
00129         if (node->flag & NODE_SELECT) {
00130             /* no groups in groups */
00131             if (node->type==NODE_GROUP)
00132                 return NULL;
00133             DO_MINMAX2( (&node->locx), min, max);
00134             totnode++;
00135         }
00136         node->done= 0;
00137     }
00138     if (totnode==0) return NULL;
00139     
00140     /* check if all connections are OK, no unselected node has both
00141      * inputs and outputs to a selection */
00142     for (link= ntree->links.first; link; link= link->next) {
00143         if (link->fromnode && link->tonode && link->fromnode->flag & NODE_SELECT)
00144             link->tonode->done |= 1;
00145         if (link->fromnode && link->tonode && link->tonode->flag & NODE_SELECT)
00146             link->fromnode->done |= 2;
00147     }   
00148     
00149     for (node= ntree->nodes.first; node; node= node->next) {
00150         if ((node->flag & NODE_SELECT)==0)
00151             if (node->done==3)
00152                 break;
00153     }
00154     if (node) 
00155         return NULL;
00156     
00157     /* OK! new nodetree */
00158     ngroup= ntreeAddTree("NodeGroup", ntree->type, NODE_GROUP);
00159     
00160     /* move nodes over */
00161     for (node= ntree->nodes.first; node; node= nextn) {
00162         nextn= node->next;
00163         if (node->flag & NODE_SELECT) {
00164             /* keep track of this node's RNA "base" path (the part of the pat identifying the node) 
00165              * if the old nodetree has animation data which potentially covers this node
00166              */
00167             if (ntree->adt) {
00168                 PointerRNA ptr;
00169                 char *path;
00170                 
00171                 RNA_pointer_create(&ntree->id, &RNA_Node, node, &ptr);
00172                 path = RNA_path_from_ID_to_struct(&ptr);
00173                 
00174                 if (path)
00175                     BLI_addtail(&anim_basepaths, BLI_genericNodeN(path));
00176             }
00177             
00178             /* change node-collection membership */
00179             BLI_remlink(&ntree->nodes, node);
00180             BLI_addtail(&ngroup->nodes, node);
00181             
00182             node->locx-= 0.5f*(min[0]+max[0]);
00183             node->locy-= 0.5f*(min[1]+max[1]);
00184         }
00185     }
00186 
00187     /* move animation data over */
00188     if (ntree->adt) {
00189         LinkData *ld, *ldn=NULL;
00190         
00191         BKE_animdata_separate_by_basepath(&ntree->id, &ngroup->id, &anim_basepaths);
00192         
00193         /* paths + their wrappers need to be freed */
00194         for (ld = anim_basepaths.first; ld; ld = ldn) {
00195             ldn = ld->next;
00196             
00197             MEM_freeN(ld->data);
00198             BLI_freelinkN(&anim_basepaths, ld);
00199         }
00200     }
00201     
00202     /* node groups don't use internal cached data */
00203     ntreeFreeCache(ngroup);
00204     
00205     /* make group node */
00206     ntemp.type = NODE_GROUP;
00207     ntemp.ngroup = ngroup;
00208     gnode= nodeAddNode(ntree, &ntemp);
00209     gnode->locx= 0.5f*(min[0]+max[0]);
00210     gnode->locy= 0.5f*(min[1]+max[1]);
00211     
00212     /* relink external sockets */
00213     for (link= ntree->links.first; link; link= linkn) {
00214         linkn= link->next;
00215         
00216         if (link->fromnode && link->tonode && (link->fromnode->flag & link->tonode->flag & NODE_SELECT)) {
00217             BLI_remlink(&ntree->links, link);
00218             BLI_addtail(&ngroup->links, link);
00219         }
00220         else if (link->tonode && (link->tonode->flag & NODE_SELECT)) {
00221             gsock = node_group_expose_socket(ngroup, link->tosock, SOCK_IN);
00222             link->tosock->link = nodeAddLink(ngroup, NULL, gsock, link->tonode, link->tosock);
00223             link->tosock = node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &gnode->inputs, SOCK_IN, gsock);
00224             link->tonode = gnode;
00225         }
00226         else if (link->fromnode && (link->fromnode->flag & NODE_SELECT)) {
00227             /* search for existing group node socket */
00228             for (gsock=ngroup->outputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00229                 if (gsock->link && gsock->link->fromsock==link->fromsock)
00230                     break;
00231             if (!gsock) {
00232                 gsock = node_group_expose_socket(ngroup, link->fromsock, SOCK_OUT);
00233                 gsock->link = nodeAddLink(ngroup, link->fromnode, link->fromsock, NULL, gsock);
00234                 link->fromsock = node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &gnode->outputs, SOCK_OUT, gsock);
00235             }
00236             else
00237                 link->fromsock = node_group_find_output(gnode, gsock);
00238             link->fromnode = gnode;
00239         }
00240     }
00241 
00242     /* update of the group tree */
00243     ngroup->update |= NTREE_UPDATE;
00244     ntreeUpdateTree(ngroup);
00245     /* update of the tree containing the group instance node */
00246     ntree->update |= NTREE_UPDATE_NODES | NTREE_UPDATE_LINKS;
00247     ntreeUpdateTree(ntree);
00248 
00249     return gnode;
00250 }
00251 
00252 /* returns 1 if its OK */
00253 int node_group_ungroup(bNodeTree *ntree, bNode *gnode)
00254 {
00255     bNodeLink *link, *linkn;
00256     bNode *node, *nextn;
00257     bNodeTree *ngroup, *wgroup;
00258     ListBase anim_basepaths = {NULL, NULL};
00259     
00260     ngroup= (bNodeTree *)gnode->id;
00261     if (ngroup==NULL) return 0;
00262     
00263     /* clear new pointers, set in copytree */
00264     for (node= ntree->nodes.first; node; node= node->next)
00265         node->new_node= NULL;
00266     
00267     /* wgroup is a temporary copy of the NodeTree we're merging in
00268      *  - all of wgroup's nodes are transferred across to their new home
00269      *  - ngroup (i.e. the source NodeTree) is left unscathed
00270      */
00271     wgroup= ntreeCopyTree(ngroup);
00272     
00273     /* add the nodes into the ntree */
00274     for (node= wgroup->nodes.first; node; node= nextn) {
00275         nextn= node->next;
00276         
00277         /* keep track of this node's RNA "base" path (the part of the pat identifying the node) 
00278          * if the old nodetree has animation data which potentially covers this node
00279          */
00280         if (wgroup->adt) {
00281             PointerRNA ptr;
00282             char *path;
00283             
00284             RNA_pointer_create(&wgroup->id, &RNA_Node, node, &ptr);
00285             path = RNA_path_from_ID_to_struct(&ptr);
00286             
00287             if (path)
00288                 BLI_addtail(&anim_basepaths, BLI_genericNodeN(path));
00289         }
00290         
00291         /* migrate node */
00292         BLI_remlink(&wgroup->nodes, node);
00293         BLI_addtail(&ntree->nodes, node);
00294         
00295         node->locx+= gnode->locx;
00296         node->locy+= gnode->locy;
00297         
00298         node->flag |= NODE_SELECT;
00299     }
00300     
00301     /* restore external links to and from the gnode */
00302     for (link= ntree->links.first; link; link= link->next) {
00303         if (link->fromnode==gnode) {
00304             if (link->fromsock->groupsock) {
00305                 bNodeSocket *gsock= link->fromsock->groupsock;
00306                 if (gsock->link) {
00307                     if (gsock->link->fromnode) {
00308                         /* NB: using the new internal copies here! the groupsock pointer still maps to the old tree */
00309                         link->fromnode = (gsock->link->fromnode ? gsock->link->fromnode->new_node : NULL);
00310                         link->fromsock = gsock->link->fromsock->new_sock;
00311                     }
00312                     else {
00313                         /* group output directly maps to group input */
00314                         bNodeSocket *insock= node_group_find_input(gnode, gsock->link->fromsock);
00315                         if (insock->link) {
00316                             link->fromnode = insock->link->fromnode;
00317                             link->fromsock = insock->link->fromsock;
00318                         }
00319                     }
00320                 }
00321                 else {
00322                     /* copy the default input value from the group socket default to the external socket */
00323                     node_socket_convert_default_value(link->tosock->type, link->tosock->default_value, gsock->type, gsock->default_value);
00324                 }
00325             }
00326         }
00327     }
00328     /* remove internal output links, these are not used anymore */
00329     for (link=wgroup->links.first; link; link= linkn) {
00330         linkn = link->next;
00331         if (!link->tonode)
00332             nodeRemLink(wgroup, link);
00333     }
00334     /* restore links from internal nodes */
00335     for (link= wgroup->links.first; link; link= link->next) {
00336         /* indicates link to group input */
00337         if (!link->fromnode) {
00338             /* NB: can't use find_group_node_input here,
00339              * because gnode sockets still point to the old tree!
00340              */
00341             bNodeSocket *insock;
00342             for (insock= gnode->inputs.first; insock; insock= insock->next)
00343                 if (insock->groupsock->new_sock == link->fromsock)
00344                     break;
00345             if (insock->link) {
00346                 link->fromnode = insock->link->fromnode;
00347                 link->fromsock = insock->link->fromsock;
00348             }
00349             else {
00350                 /* copy the default input value from the group node socket default to the internal socket */
00351                 node_socket_convert_default_value(link->tosock->type, link->tosock->default_value, insock->type, insock->default_value);
00352                 nodeRemLink(wgroup, link);
00353             }
00354         }
00355     }
00356     
00357     /* add internal links to the ntree */
00358     for (link= wgroup->links.first; link; link= linkn) {
00359         linkn= link->next;
00360         BLI_remlink(&wgroup->links, link);
00361         BLI_addtail(&ntree->links, link);
00362     }
00363     
00364     /* and copy across the animation,
00365      * note that the animation data's action can be NULL here */
00366     if (wgroup->adt) {
00367         LinkData *ld, *ldn=NULL;
00368         bAction *waction;
00369         
00370         /* firstly, wgroup needs to temporary dummy action that can be destroyed, as it shares copies */
00371         waction = wgroup->adt->action = copy_action(wgroup->adt->action);
00372         
00373         /* now perform the moving */
00374         BKE_animdata_separate_by_basepath(&wgroup->id, &ntree->id, &anim_basepaths);
00375         
00376         /* paths + their wrappers need to be freed */
00377         for (ld = anim_basepaths.first; ld; ld = ldn) {
00378             ldn = ld->next;
00379             
00380             MEM_freeN(ld->data);
00381             BLI_freelinkN(&anim_basepaths, ld);
00382         }
00383         
00384         /* free temp action too */
00385         if (waction) {
00386             free_libblock(&G.main->action, waction);
00387         }
00388     }
00389     
00390     /* delete the group instance. this also removes old input links! */
00391     nodeFreeNode(ntree, gnode);
00392 
00393     /* free the group tree (takes care of user count) */
00394     free_libblock(&G.main->nodetree, wgroup);
00395     
00396     ntree->update |= NTREE_UPDATE_NODES | NTREE_UPDATE_LINKS;
00397     ntreeUpdateTree(ntree);
00398     
00399     return 1;
00400 }
00401 
00402 bNodeSocket *node_group_add_socket(bNodeTree *ngroup, const char *name, int type, int in_out)
00403 {
00404     bNodeSocketType *stype = ntreeGetSocketType(type);
00405     bNodeSocket *gsock = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bNodeSocket), "bNodeSocket");
00406     
00407     BLI_strncpy(gsock->name, name, sizeof(gsock->name));
00408     gsock->type = type;
00409     /* group sockets are dynamically added */
00410     gsock->flag |= SOCK_DYNAMIC;
00411 
00412     gsock->next = gsock->prev = NULL;
00413     gsock->new_sock = NULL;
00414     gsock->link = NULL;
00415     /* assign new unique index */
00416     gsock->own_index = ngroup->cur_index++;
00417     gsock->limit = (in_out==SOCK_IN ? 0xFFF : 1);
00418     
00419     if (stype->value_structsize > 0)
00420         gsock->default_value = MEM_callocN(stype->value_structsize, "default socket value");
00421     
00422     BLI_addtail(in_out==SOCK_IN ? &ngroup->inputs : &ngroup->outputs, gsock);
00423     
00424     ngroup->update |= (in_out==SOCK_IN ? NTREE_UPDATE_GROUP_IN : NTREE_UPDATE_GROUP_OUT);
00425     
00426     return gsock;
00427 }
00428 
00429 bNodeSocket *node_group_expose_socket(bNodeTree *ngroup, bNodeSocket *sock, int in_out)
00430 {
00431     bNodeSocket *gsock= node_group_add_socket(ngroup, sock->name, sock->type, in_out);
00432     
00433     /* initialize the default value. */
00434     node_socket_copy_default_value(gsock->type, gsock->default_value, sock->default_value);
00435     
00436     return gsock;
00437 }
00438 
00439 void node_group_expose_all_sockets(bNodeTree *ngroup)
00440 {
00441     bNode *node;
00442     bNodeSocket *sock, *gsock;
00443     
00444     for (node=ngroup->nodes.first; node; node=node->next) {
00445         for (sock=node->inputs.first; sock; sock=sock->next) {
00446             if (!sock->link && !nodeSocketIsHidden(sock)) {
00447                 gsock = node_group_add_socket(ngroup, sock->name, sock->type, SOCK_IN);
00448                 
00449                 /* initialize the default value. */
00450                 node_socket_copy_default_value(gsock->type, gsock->default_value, sock->default_value);
00451                 
00452                 sock->link = nodeAddLink(ngroup, NULL, gsock, node, sock);
00453             }
00454         }
00455         for (sock=node->outputs.first; sock; sock=sock->next) {
00456             if (nodeCountSocketLinks(ngroup, sock)==0 && !nodeSocketIsHidden(sock)) {
00457                 gsock = node_group_add_socket(ngroup, sock->name, sock->type, SOCK_OUT);
00458                 
00459                 /* initialize the default value. */
00460                 node_socket_copy_default_value(gsock->type, gsock->default_value, sock->default_value);
00461                 
00462                 gsock->link = nodeAddLink(ngroup, node, sock, NULL, gsock);
00463             }
00464         }
00465     }
00466 }
00467 
00468 void node_group_remove_socket(bNodeTree *ngroup, bNodeSocket *gsock, int in_out)
00469 {
00470     nodeRemSocketLinks(ngroup, gsock);
00471     
00472     switch (in_out) {
00473     case SOCK_IN:
00474         BLI_remlink(&ngroup->inputs, gsock);
00475         ngroup->update |= NTREE_UPDATE_GROUP_IN;
00476         break;
00477     case SOCK_OUT:
00478         BLI_remlink(&ngroup->outputs, gsock);
00479         ngroup->update |= NTREE_UPDATE_GROUP_OUT;
00480         break;
00481     }
00482     
00483     if (gsock->default_value)
00484         MEM_freeN(gsock->default_value);
00485     
00486     MEM_freeN(gsock);
00487 }
00488 
00489 /* groups display their internal tree name as label */
00490 const char *node_group_label(bNode *node)
00491 {
00492     return (node->id)? node->id->name+2: IFACE_("Missing Datablock");
00493 }
00494 
00495 int node_group_valid(bNodeTree *ntree, bNodeTemplate *ntemp)
00496 {
00497     bNodeTemplate childtemp;
00498     bNode *node;
00499     
00500     /* regular groups cannot be recursive */
00501     if (ntree == ntemp->ngroup)
00502         return 0;
00503     
00504     /* make sure all children are valid */
00505     for (node=ntemp->ngroup->nodes.first; node; node=node->next) {
00506         childtemp = nodeMakeTemplate(node);
00507         if (!nodeValid(ntree, &childtemp))
00508             return 0;
00509     }
00510     
00511     return 1;
00512 }
00513 
00514 bNodeTemplate node_group_template(bNode *node)
00515 {
00516     bNodeTemplate ntemp;
00517     ntemp.type = NODE_GROUP;
00518     ntemp.ngroup = (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00519     return ntemp;
00520 }
00521 
00522 void node_group_init(bNodeTree *ntree, bNode *node, bNodeTemplate *ntemp)
00523 {
00524     node->id = (ID*)ntemp->ngroup;
00525     
00526     /* NB: group socket input/output roles are inverted internally!
00527      * Group "inputs" work as outputs in links and vice versa.
00528      */
00529     if (ntemp->ngroup) {
00530         bNodeSocket *gsock;
00531         for (gsock=ntemp->ngroup->inputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00532             node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &node->inputs, SOCK_IN, gsock);
00533         for (gsock=ntemp->ngroup->outputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00534             node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &node->outputs, SOCK_OUT, gsock);
00535     }
00536 }
00537 
00538 static bNodeSocket *group_verify_socket(bNodeTree *ntree, ListBase *lb, int in_out, bNodeSocket *gsock)
00539 {
00540     bNodeSocket *sock;
00541     
00542     /* group sockets tagged as internal are not exposed ever */
00543     if (gsock->flag & SOCK_INTERNAL)
00544         return NULL;
00545     
00546     for (sock= lb->first; sock; sock= sock->next) {
00547         if (sock->own_index==gsock->own_index)
00548                 break;
00549     }
00550     if (sock) {
00551         sock->groupsock = gsock;
00552         
00553         BLI_strncpy(sock->name, gsock->name, sizeof(sock->name));
00554         sock->type= gsock->type;
00555         
00556         /* XXX hack: group socket input/output roles are inverted internally,
00557          * need to change the limit value when making actual node sockets from them.
00558          */
00559         sock->limit = (in_out==SOCK_IN ? 1 : 0xFFF);
00560         
00561         BLI_remlink(lb, sock);
00562         
00563         return sock;
00564     }
00565     else {
00566         return node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, NULL, in_out, gsock);
00567     }
00568 }
00569 
00570 static void group_verify_socket_list(bNodeTree *ntree, bNode *node, ListBase *lb, int in_out, ListBase *glb)
00571 {
00572     bNodeSocket *sock, *nextsock, *gsock;
00573     
00574     /* step by step compare */
00575     for (gsock= glb->first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next) {
00576         /* abusing new_sock pointer for verification here! only used inside this function */
00577         gsock->new_sock= group_verify_socket(ntree, lb, in_out, gsock);
00578     }
00579     /* leftovers are removed */
00580     for (sock=lb->first; sock; sock=nextsock) {
00581         nextsock=sock->next;
00582         if (sock->flag & SOCK_DYNAMIC)
00583             nodeRemoveSocket(ntree, node, sock);
00584     }
00585     /* and we put back the verified sockets */
00586     for (gsock= glb->first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next) {
00587         if (gsock->new_sock) {
00588             BLI_addtail(lb, gsock->new_sock);
00589             gsock->new_sock = NULL;
00590         }
00591     }
00592 }
00593 
00594 /* make sure all group node in ntree, which use ngroup, are sync'd */
00595 void node_group_verify(struct bNodeTree *ntree, struct bNode *node, struct ID *id)
00596 {
00597     /* check inputs and outputs, and remove or insert them */
00598     if (node->id==id) {
00599         bNodeTree *ngroup= (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00600         group_verify_socket_list(ntree, node, &node->inputs, SOCK_IN, &ngroup->inputs);
00601         group_verify_socket_list(ntree, node, &node->outputs, SOCK_OUT, &ngroup->outputs);
00602     }
00603 }
00604 
00605 struct bNodeTree *node_group_edit_get(bNode *node)
00606 {
00607     if (node->flag & NODE_GROUP_EDIT)
00608         return (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00609     else
00610         return NULL;
00611 }
00612 
00613 struct bNodeTree *node_group_edit_set(bNode *node, int edit)
00614 {
00615     if (edit) {
00616         bNodeTree *ngroup= (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00617         if (ngroup) {
00618             if (ngroup->id.lib)
00619                 ntreeMakeLocal(ngroup);
00620             
00621             node->flag |= NODE_GROUP_EDIT;
00622         }
00623         return ngroup;
00624     }
00625     else {
00626         node->flag &= ~NODE_GROUP_EDIT;
00627         return NULL;
00628     }
00629 }
00630 
00631 void node_group_edit_clear(bNode *node)
00632 {
00633     bNodeTree *ngroup= (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00634     bNode *inode;
00635     
00636     node->flag &= ~NODE_GROUP_EDIT;
00637     
00638     if (ngroup)
00639         for (inode=ngroup->nodes.first; inode; inode=inode->next)
00640             nodeGroupEditClear(inode);
00641 }
00642 
00643 void node_group_link(bNodeTree *ntree, bNodeSocket *sock, int in_out)
00644 {
00645     node_group_expose_socket(ntree, sock, in_out);
00646 }
00647 
00648 /**** For Loop ****/
00649 
00650 /* Essentially a group node with slightly different behavior.
00651  * The internal tree is executed several times, with each output being re-used
00652  * as an input in the next iteration. For this purpose, input and output socket
00653  * lists are kept identical!
00654  */
00655 
00656 bNodeTemplate node_forloop_template(bNode *node)
00657 {
00658     bNodeTemplate ntemp;
00659     ntemp.type = NODE_FORLOOP;
00660     ntemp.ngroup = (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00661     return ntemp;
00662 }
00663 
00664 void node_forloop_init(bNodeTree *ntree, bNode *node, bNodeTemplate *ntemp)
00665 {
00666     bNodeSocket *sock;
00667     
00668     node->id = (ID*)ntemp->ngroup;
00669     
00670     sock = nodeAddSocket(ntree, node, SOCK_IN, "Iterations", SOCK_FLOAT);
00671     node_socket_set_default_value_float(sock->default_value, PROP_UNSIGNED, 1, 0, 10000);
00672     
00673     /* NB: group socket input/output roles are inverted internally!
00674      * Group "inputs" work as outputs in links and vice versa.
00675      */
00676     if (ntemp->ngroup) {
00677         bNodeSocket *gsock;
00678         for (gsock=ntemp->ngroup->inputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00679             node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &node->inputs, SOCK_IN, gsock);
00680         for (gsock=ntemp->ngroup->outputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00681             node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &node->outputs, SOCK_OUT, gsock);
00682     }
00683 }
00684 
00685 void node_forloop_init_tree(bNodeTree *ntree)
00686 {
00687     bNodeSocket *sock;
00688     sock = node_group_add_socket(ntree, "Iteration", SOCK_FLOAT, SOCK_IN);
00689     sock->flag |= SOCK_INTERNAL;
00690 }
00691 
00692 static void loop_sync(bNodeTree *ntree, int sync_in_out)
00693 {
00694     bNodeSocket *sock, *sync, *nsync, *mirror;
00695     ListBase *sync_lb;
00696     
00697     if (sync_in_out==SOCK_IN) {
00698         sock = ntree->outputs.first;
00699         
00700         sync = ntree->inputs.first;
00701         sync_lb = &ntree->inputs;
00702     }
00703     else {
00704         sock = ntree->inputs.first;
00705         
00706         sync = ntree->outputs.first;
00707         sync_lb = &ntree->outputs;
00708     }
00709     
00710     /* NB: the sock->storage pointer is used here directly to store the own_index int
00711      * out the mirrored socket counterpart!
00712      */
00713     
00714     while (sock) {
00715         /* skip static and internal sockets on the sync side (preserves socket order!) */
00716         while (sync && ((sync->flag & SOCK_INTERNAL) || !(sync->flag & SOCK_DYNAMIC)))
00717             sync = sync->next;
00718         
00719         if (sync && !(sync->flag & SOCK_INTERNAL) && (sync->flag & SOCK_DYNAMIC)) {
00720             if (sock->storage==NULL) {
00721                 /* if mirror index is 0, the sockets is newly added and a new mirror must be created. */
00722                 mirror = node_group_expose_socket(ntree, sock, sync_in_out);
00723                 /* store the mirror index */
00724                 sock->storage = SET_INT_IN_POINTER(mirror->own_index);
00725                 mirror->storage = SET_INT_IN_POINTER(sock->own_index);
00726                 /* move mirror to the right place */
00727                 BLI_remlink(sync_lb, mirror);
00728                 if (sync)
00729                     BLI_insertlinkbefore(sync_lb, sync, mirror);
00730                 else
00731                     BLI_addtail(sync_lb, mirror);
00732             }
00733             else {
00734                 /* look up the mirror socket */
00735                 for (mirror=sync; mirror; mirror=mirror->next)
00736                     if (mirror->own_index == GET_INT_FROM_POINTER(sock->storage))
00737                         break;
00738                 /* make sure the name is the same (only for identification by user, no deeper meaning) */
00739                 BLI_strncpy(mirror->name, sock->name, sizeof(mirror->name));
00740                 /* fix the socket order if necessary */
00741                 if (mirror != sync) {
00742                     BLI_remlink(sync_lb, mirror);
00743                     BLI_insertlinkbefore(sync_lb, sync, mirror);
00744                 }
00745                 else
00746                     sync = sync->next;
00747             }
00748         }
00749         
00750         sock = sock->next;
00751     }
00752     
00753     /* remaining sockets in sync_lb are leftovers from deleted sockets, remove them */
00754     while (sync) {
00755         nsync = sync->next;
00756         if (!(sync->flag & SOCK_INTERNAL) && (sync->flag & SOCK_DYNAMIC))
00757             node_group_remove_socket(ntree, sync, sync_in_out);
00758         sync = nsync;
00759     }
00760 }
00761 
00762 void node_loop_update_tree(bNodeTree *ngroup)
00763 {
00764     /* make sure inputs & outputs are identical */
00765     if (ngroup->update & NTREE_UPDATE_GROUP_IN)
00766         loop_sync(ngroup, SOCK_OUT);
00767     if (ngroup->update & NTREE_UPDATE_GROUP_OUT)
00768         loop_sync(ngroup, SOCK_IN);
00769 }
00770 
00771 void node_whileloop_init(bNodeTree *ntree, bNode *node, bNodeTemplate *ntemp)
00772 {
00773     bNodeSocket *sock;
00774     
00775     node->id = (ID*)ntemp->ngroup;
00776     
00777     sock = nodeAddSocket(ntree, node, SOCK_IN, "Condition", SOCK_FLOAT);
00778     node_socket_set_default_value_float(sock->default_value, PROP_NONE, 1, 0, 1);
00779     
00780     /* max iterations */
00781     node->custom1 = 10000;
00782     
00783     /* NB: group socket input/output roles are inverted internally!
00784      * Group "inputs" work as outputs in links and vice versa.
00785      */
00786     if (ntemp->ngroup) {
00787         bNodeSocket *gsock;
00788         for (gsock=ntemp->ngroup->inputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00789             node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &node->inputs, SOCK_IN, gsock);
00790         for (gsock=ntemp->ngroup->outputs.first; gsock; gsock=gsock->next)
00791             node_group_add_extern_socket(ntree, &node->outputs, SOCK_OUT, gsock);
00792     }
00793 }
00794 
00795 void node_whileloop_init_tree(bNodeTree *ntree)
00796 {
00797     bNodeSocket *sock;
00798     sock = node_group_add_socket(ntree, "Condition", SOCK_FLOAT, SOCK_OUT);
00799     sock->flag |= SOCK_INTERNAL;
00800 }
00801 
00802 bNodeTemplate node_whileloop_template(bNode *node)
00803 {
00804     bNodeTemplate ntemp;
00805     ntemp.type = NODE_WHILELOOP;
00806     ntemp.ngroup = (bNodeTree*)node->id;
00807     return ntemp;
00808 }
00809 
00810 /**** FRAME ****/
00811 
00812 void register_node_type_frame(bNodeTreeType *ttype)
00813 {
00814     /* frame type is used for all tree types, needs dynamic allocation */
00815     bNodeType *ntype= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bNodeType), "frame node type");
00816 
00817     node_type_base(ttype, ntype, NODE_FRAME, "Frame", NODE_CLASS_LAYOUT, NODE_BACKGROUND);
00818     node_type_size(ntype, 150, 100, 0);
00819     node_type_compatibility(ntype, NODE_OLD_SHADING|NODE_NEW_SHADING);
00820     
00821     ntype->needs_free = 1;
00822     nodeRegisterType(ttype, ntype);
00823 }
